reviewText: "Griot", the West African term for storyteller, inspired this testament to the diverse stories of New York City. Choreographer Garth Fagan, composer and jazz master Wynton Marsalis and sculptor Martin Puryear created this full-length ballet for the PBS Dance in America series, to comment on the best and the worst about the twentieth century and the city of New York. Fagan explains the concepts behind the piece in an eight minute introduction. 87 Minutes in length.
